explanation: The report is correct. In the supplied project configuration LFS_UNLOCK(lfs->cfg) expands to ((void)cfg), which is an evaluated expression with no side effects. It is executed unconditionally in lfs_file_size(), and removing that statement would not change the behaviour of the compiled program — which matches the rule’s definition of dead code. This is not unreachable code (note 2) so it falls under MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2. (It is relevant that the macro may be a placeholder for other build configurations, but Rule 2.2 applies to the project as actually built; in the present configuration the statement is dead.)
